labels.value: There is some action already in queue. Please refresh page after some time.
No active data sets match the search criteria.
No active data set. Please select Active on the root element and try again.
An active connection to the current source org must be defined before deployment.
No active organization connections found. On the Connections tab, click New and create connections to your source and destination organizations.
All events configured for deactivation.
Delete All Deployment Results
Delete Deployment Record Results

labels.shortDescription: CHANGE RULE ACTION MIX NOT SUPPORTED
labels.value: Mixing different rule actions for one view is not supported.
This action is not currently supported, please select another one
A rule with a filter not set to Component Type must have a parent rule set to Component Type
A rule with a filter set to Component Type must not have a parent rule
The Namespace filter is currently only supported with an Object or Email Template metadata types

labels.shortDescription: CHANGE RULE NAMESPACE SUPPORTED COMPONENT TYPES
labels.value: This filter value is not currently supported as Component Type, please specify a supported type

labels.shortDescription: Provides access to the child objects of the current data set element's deploymen
labels.value: CHILD RELATIONSHIPS
This action cannot be undone, permanently deletes the deployment results for all individual records, and resets the reports for individual records on the AppOps Deployment Dashboard. Are you sure?

This action cannot be undone, permanently deletes all deployment, batch, deployment plan, data set, and individual results records, and resets all reports on the AppOps Deployment Dashboard. Instead, Prodly recommends using Delete Deployment Record Results to delete only the individual record results and retain the accuracy of your deployment reports. Are you sure?
This action deletes the selected deployment results and cannot be undone. The results will no longer be accounted for in the deployment results reports. Are you sure?
This action reruns the deployment associated with the selected deployment results. Are you sure?
Are you sure you want to stop this deployment?
Specifies the specific instance URL for OAuth token requests.
Specifies an optional, human-readable name of the connection. When blank, AppOps sets this field to the organizationâ€™s company name during connection creation.
Specifies the type of Salesforce org. Select from the list of available org types.
A quick shortcut step containing the list of sandboxes associated with your control org. Select from this list to quickly populate the Username and Instance URL boxes.

For Authorized Access, the Prodly AppOps service authenticates connections using the refresh token OAuth flow. For Preauthorized Access, the Prodly AppOps service authenticates using the JSON web token (JWT) OAuth flow.
Specifies the username of the Salesforce user (for example, your_name@your_company.your_org) to use for the OAuth connection authentication.
Specifies an optional custom Salesforce domain.
Deactivate
We are moving to a new view for deployments. Take a look at the Guided Deployment section in the AppOps Release tab.
This deployment was terminated because it has been paused for more than a week.
Deployment object <Object API Name> for data set element <Data Set Element Name> does not exist in the current schema org. Please select a schema org that contains the deployment object.
No deployment plans match the search criteria.
Deployment has been submitted. This page will automatically refresh with the latest results or reload the page to force an update.
Request has been submitted successfully. Kindly refresh page after sometime.
At least one destination org IDs must be specified.
Either the data set or deployment plan ID must be specified.
Enable Transformations
Endpoint is missing or an error occurred with the endpoint URL.

The number of schema objects you are attempting to display on one picklist page is larger than Salesforce currently allows. Please decrease the allowable number at Setup > Custom Settings > Object Selector Page Size to less than 1000.

Salesforce API request limit exceeded for the schema org you are selecting. Monitor Setup > Environment > System Overview > API Usage until Salesforce resets your limit, or ask Safesforce for a one-time limit increase, then try again.
At least one active connection to a target org must be defined before deployment.
Invalid or expired schema connection. Please select a valid schema org connection.
No schema selected for this data set. Please use Data Set Controls > Schema Org to select a schema for this data set.

The control org connection is invalid or has been revoked. AppOps will remove and recreate the control org connection, then prompt you to reenter the connection you were creating. If the issue persists, email support@prodly.co.
The data set / data set element no longer exists. Click the Data Sets tab to refresh the list views and display the available data sets / data set elements.
Data set found when deployment plan expected. Terminating process. Select Generate Data Set instead.
Data set element not found. AppOps will delete this entry on next save.
The data set element you selected is inactive or longer exists. AppOps will delete any related event controls on next save.
The destination connection does not allow to be used as a destination.
ERROR_DO_NOT_PROVIDE_FULL_URL
The connection set as your control org connection is not to your control org. On the Connections tab, ensure the Control Org checkbox is selected only on the connection to your control org.
Finish Date is a required field on Implementation . Please enter a value.
Porject Type is a required field on Implementation . Please enter a value.

This event no longer exists in the destination schema org. AppOps will remove the event control from your data set on next save. To keep the event control in your data set, select a schema that includes the event.
The selected file is above the maximum allowed file size limit.
An unexpected error has occurred. Please email support@prodly.co with a description of what you were doing at the time and include the following information:
Data set found when deployment plan expected. Terminating process. Use the Data Set Import Lightning component instead.
Deployment plan found when data set expected. Terminating process. Use the Deployment Plan Import Lightning component instead.
Invalid control org connection.
Invalid data set Id <dataSetId> in API request.
Invalid deployment plan Id <deploymentPlantId> in API request.

The <objectname> object does not exist in destination schema org. AppOps will remove the associated event controls from your data set on next save. To keep the event controls in your data set, select a schema that includes the object.
Invalid filter criteria. Please review and correct the value you have entered for Query Filter.
URL must start with /services/apexrest/
Invalid token. Unable to access token because of incomplete connection record.
Invalid source organization connection Id <sourceConnectionId> in API request.

This data set element no longer exists in the data set. AppOps will remove the invocation from your data set on next save. To keep an invocation at the same point in your deployment, add a new invocation.
No active connection to your control organization found. Click New on the Connections tab to establish one before attempting a deployment.
There is no active connection exists
The connection to the destination schema org is no longer valid. Ensure that an active Connection record exists for your destination schema org.
No events of this type exist in your destination schema org.
No fields selected for <Dataset Element>. Select Copy All Fields or individual fields and try again.

Unexpected issue with your control organization connection. Either it doesn't exist, is Inactive, or has become Invalid. On the Connections tab, delete the connection (if present), then click New to establish a new connection.
No target connection ID has been specified.
AppOps cannot retrieve the events for this object. Ensure that active Connection records exist for your control org and your destination schema org.
There is no event item for selected object.
Unexpected Error .query returned no data. Please check your organization connections.
Schema connection is missing or invalid. Please select a valid schema org connection (or leave blank to use your control org as the schema org) and resave the data set.

To deploy account records, you must include the Account Name field and, for personal accounts, also the Last Name field. On the OBJECT FIELDS tab of your Account data set element, select the individual fields or Copy All Fields, then try again.
Deployment plan found when data set expected. Terminating process. Select Generate Deployment Plan instead.
Deployment plan items cannot be reassigned. To move the item to another plan, delete the item here and recreate it on the other deployment plan.
You have reached the limit of 200 field transformations for this data set.
You have reached the limit of 100 picklist value transformations for this data set.
You have reached the limit of 50 parent and child relationship transformations for this data set.
Maximum record selection limit is 50000.
Data Set Element Name is a required field. Please enter a value.
Deployment object <Object API Name> for data set element <Data Set Element Name> does not exist in the current source org. Please select a source org that contains the deployment object.
Please select one source organization and one to five destination organizations before clicking Deploy.
An org cannot function as both a source and destination. Please ensure you have not selected your source org also as a destination org.
String too long. Reduce Data Set Element Name to 70 characters so AppOps can append ' - CLONED' and try again.
Either the destination org has revoked access or the connection record owner is not authorized to access the org.
Template file exceeds the maximum allowable file size. To proceed, reduce the number of items in your deployment plan or data set(s).
Unable to Stop/Pause/Resume the deployment process because either the record ID is missing or the record is not found.
An unknown error has occurred while committing data to the database. Please refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, email support@prodly.co for assistance.
An unknown error has occurred. Please refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, email support@prodly.co for assistance.
Select Salesforce events, such as triggers or validation rules, to deactivate during the deployment. Note: actual events in the destination org could differ.

Deactivating events changes the destination org configuration and there is a possibility that the events will not be automatically activated after deployment. Carefully consider the repercussions before using this feature.
Data Set
Data Set Element
Invalid request: deployment has already finished.
Specifies an optional folder that contains the connection.
Import successful.
Processing delete request. This process might take a few minutes to comlpete.
The first active connection you establish must be to the control org, otherwise subsequent steps will not function correctly. Enter a name and click Create to proceed.
Invalid destination organization connection Id <targetConnectionId> in API request.
Invalid request: unknow error. Refresh the page and try again.
View instructions.

The JWT OAuth flow requires you have the Prodly AppOps Deployment connected app installed (Setup > Connected Apps OAuth Usage) and Permitted Users set to Admin approved users are pre-authorized (Setup > Manage Connected Apps).

labels.shortDescription: MISSING SIMULATION DEPLOYMENT RESULT TYPE ERROR
labels.value: Unable to initiate simulation. Make sure Setup > Objects and Fields > Picklist Value Sets > Deployment Type includes a value for "Simulation" and try again.
Too many datasets are selected. Please limit the number of dataset to ten per deployment.
Too many destination orgs. Please limit the number of destination orgs to five per deployment.
No data records were processed. Try broadening the selection criteria or run the simulation/deployment again.
No events configured for deactivation.
No result found

labels.value: Object Fields
Element Details

labels.value: PARENT RELATIONSHIPS

Reloads the page with the latest activity. This page does not automatically refresh.
Specifies the order to deploy the relationships. Leave blank to deploy in random order.
Enter a string to limit display to only the deployment activities whose category, subject, error key, or error code contain the string.

When selected, the data set element is available for deployment. When deselected on a root element, the entire data set becomes inactive. When deselected on a non-root element, AppOps skips deploying the associated object and all of its relationships.
Creates an invocation from an invocation template and adds the invocation to the Invocations list.

For VEID elements only, specifies a deployment object API name and its data set to add to the mapping list, which tells AppOps to map the corresponding lookup IDs in the destination text field. AppOps disables this setting when you select Set Empty, Scramble Value, or Fixed Value.
Specifies a picklist value to add to the mapping list.
Deactivates all events for the given object.
Success.
In progress with no failures.
Deployment failure.
Deployment record failure.
In progress with few failures.

Specifies the maximum number of records to deploy in each deployment batch. When blank, AppOps attempts to use the maximum allowable number of 10,000 records. The total number of records is limited by the total CSV size of the data in the records.
Provides access to the child objects of the current data set element's deployment object.
Lists the objects with events you desire to control. Click the cards to edit the event controls for each object.

When selected, AppOps deploys all of the fields in the object, even fields you might add after creating the data set. When deselected, AppOps relies on individual field checkmarks to determine which fields to deploy.
Copies the parent lookup field value as is, rather than performing an upsert. You must guarantee the integrity and uniqueness of the ID manually.

When selected, AppOps searches the destination organization for this custom field and if not found, creates the field in the destination organization. When deselected, AppOps silently ignores the field.

When selected, AppOps searches the destination organization for source organization custom fields and if not found, creates the fields in the destination organization. When deselected, AppOps silently ignores the source fields that don't exist in the destination organization.
Specifies an optional description of the data set for easier reference.
Limits the scope of this event control to a single data set element.
Specifies the human-readable name of the data set element. The name of the root element doubles as the name of the data set.
Data set has been successfully saved.
When selected, all possible events for objects in the data set will be deactivated for the duration of the deployment. Refer to the user guide for details.
Deactivates all events for the selected scope. When selected, all individual DEACTIVATE checkboxes disable.

Inserts the record using the Temporary Value you specify for this field during deployment, then defers deployment of the actual data in this field until after the Deploy After Child Relationship data set element deploys.

Permanently deletes all deployment results records and deployment activity records, effectively resetting all reports on the AppOps Deployment Dashboard. This action cannot be undone and all deployment tracking information will be lost.

Permanently deletes deployment results for all individual records and cannot be undone. Retains deployment activity and deployment, batch, deployment plan, and data set results. Resets only the individual record reports on the AppOps Deployment Dashboard.

Use these delete buttons to free memory in your control organization. Deleting deployment results records affects the accuracy of the reports on the Deployment Dashboard. Prodly recommends using these buttons only as a last resort.
Lists the data set to deploy.
Enter a search string to display only the data sets whose DATA SET NAME, DEPLOYMENT OBJECT, or NAMESPACE contain the string.
Lists the data sets available for deployment. Select up to 10 data sets to deploy.
Specifies a human-readable name for the deployment.
Optional deployment name...

Specifies an optional summary of your deployment to include in your deployment results. For example, describe any details of your deployment, capture notes such as deployment steps, include a link to your tasks and folders, etc...

Specifies the Salesforce object to use as the basis of the data set element. For the root element, a picklist shows all of the Salesforce objects available in the schema that are accessible, queryable, and can either be updated or inserted. For non-root elements, this field is read-only, determined by your selections on the PARENT OBJECTS and CHILD OBJECTS tabs.
Optional deployment notes...
Enter a search string to display only the deployment plans whose DEPLOYMENT PLAN NAME contains the string.
Lists the deployment plans available for deployment. Select 1 deployment plan to deploy.
Inserts or updates the record using the Temporary Value you specify for this field during deployment, then defers deployment of the actual data in this field until the end of the deployment.

Specifies the organization that contains the schema the data set editor uses for features that pertain specifically to the destination organization. When blank, AppOps uses Schema Org. When Schema Org is also blank, AppOps uses the control organization.

Specifies the object in the destination org to which AppOps deploys data from the Deployment Object in the source org. Leave blank to use same object. Not all objects appear in the list by default. Type a few letters of your object name to filter the list.
User can search and select an object for transformation.
Specifies the organization to copy data to. Use Ctrl+click to select up to five destinations.
When selected, AppOps does not list or allow the organization as a destination for data migration.
Provides access to the properties for the current data set element.

When selected, the Data Transformation section appears, allowing you to specify mapping source org data to different objects, record types, fields, picklist values, and relationship names in the destination org.

When deselected, AppOps migrates parent records that are required because of related lookups even when the parent records don't meet your query filter criteria. When selected, AppOps migrates only the records that meet your query filter criteria.
Lists events eligible for deactivation. Select DEACTIVATE on individual events to deactivate them. Unselected DEACTIVATE checkboxes disable when the maximum event controls limit is reached.

Allows you to instruct AppOps Release to temporarily deactivate select trigger, workflow, validation rule, duplicate rule, and process events for an object, then reactivate the events after deployment.
Adds an object to the Objects with Event Controls list. Not all objects appear in the list by default. Type a few letters of your object name to filter the list.
Specifies whether to deactivate events at the start of the data set or data set element deployment. AppOps reactivates the events at the end of the data set or data set element deployment.
Includes the field as part of the composite external ID for upserts. AppOps disables this setting when you enter Prefix Value or Postfix Value.
Sets the field to a fixed value in the destination organization. AppOps disables this setting when you select text IDs to map.
Enter the value to store in the destination field.
Specifies the folder that contains the data set.

When selected, AppOps ignores namespace mismatches for object and fields. If the namespaces do not match or one organization has a namespace and the other does not, AppOps still considers the fields a match. When deselected, the namespaces must match.
When Ignore Namespace is selected, this box specifies the namespace to ignore.

For non-root elements only. When selected, AppOps copies all source organization records of this object type to the destination organization. When deselected, AppOps only copies records related to the parent or child records.
Imports a data set from a template file you (or another user) created in the data set editor and downloaded from the template details page.
Imports a deployment plan with data sets from a template file you (or another user) created in the deployment plan details page and downloaded from the template details page.

Imports a data set or deployment plan with data sets from a template file you (or another user) created in the data set editor or deployment plan details page, and downloaded from the template details page.
Lists the endpoints to invoke during deployment.
Specifies whether to invoke the endpoint before or after the entry you selected for Invocation Scope.
TOOL_TIP_INVOCATION_ORG
Specifies whether to invoke the endpoint in conjunction with the data set or the data set element.
When Invocation Scope is Data Set Element, AppOps invokes the endpoint in conjunction with the data set element you specify.
Specifies the org in which to invoke the endpoint.
Specifies the invocation template to use to create this invocation. Select an existing template or --Create New Invocation Template-- to create an invocation template from scratch.

AppOps Release skips invoking this endpoint during deployment because the invocation template for this invocation is inactive. To include this invocation in your deployment, navigate to the Invocation Templates tab and reactivate the invocation template.
Specifies the name of the invocation template.
Specifies the URL of the invocation endpoint. Start your entry with /services/apexrest/ and AppOps creates the full URL.
Lists the deployment object API name and data set containing text lookup IDs AppOps searches for in the source text field and remaps in the corresponding destination text field during deployment.
Master-Detail
Provides access to the fields of the current data set element's deployment object.
Provides access to the parent objects of the current data set element's deployment object.
AppOps cannot access this object because the current user does not have permission to do so.
Appends the given value to the existing field value. AppOps disables this setting when you select External ID.
Prepends the given value to the existing field value. AppOps disables this setting when you select External ID.
Specify the Process Builder events to deactivate.
Specifies an optional SOQL query WHERE clause that determines which source data records to copy during deployment.
Specifies the maximum number of records to deploy. Leave blank to deploy all records.

Displays a list of the record types AppOps finds for the Deployment Object in the source schema and, for each record type, allows you to specify transformation to any record type AppOps finds for the Destination Deployment Object in the destination schema.

When selected, assigns ownership of the destination record to the owner of the source record. When deselected, assigns ownership to the username used to establish the connection to the destination organization.

When selected, sets the record type of destination record to the record type of source record. When deselected, sets record type of destination record to the default record type of the user who established the connection to the destination organization.
Required Lookup
Specifies the organization that contains the schema the data set editor uses for data set creation. When blank, AppOps uses the schema from your control organization.
Displays picklists that allow you to specify alternate schemas. By default, AppOps Release uses the local schema from your control org for data set creation and deployment.
Replaces the field's value in the destination org with random, anonymized data to obfuscate sensitive information. AppOps Release disables this setting when you select text IDs to map.
Enter a string to limit display to only the relationships whose name, API name, ID field, or namespace contain the string.
Enter a search string to display only the fields whose LABEL or API NAME contain the string.
Specifies the namespace AppOps uses to filter the list. Leave the box blank to filter on all managed packages.

When selected, AppOps migrates the Salesforce audit field values of source records during deployment. When deselected, the Salesforce audit field values in destination records reflect the deployment date, time, and username of the destination connection.
Sets the field to an empty value in the destination organization. AppOps disables this setting when you select text IDs to map.
Lists the data set to simulate.
When selected, AppOps does not deploy records unless the records already exist in the destination org.
Skips processing of the data set elements related to this parent record by ignoring elements selected farther down the chain in the Parent Objects and Child Objects tabs of the data set editor.
When selected, AppOps does not deploy records that already exist in the destination org, regardless of whether or not the data matches.
Specifies the organization to copy data from.
Ensures the destination organizationâ€™s values for the picklist match the values in the source organization.

When selected, AppOps ensures the destination organizationâ€™s values for all picklists you select for deployment match the values in the source organization. AppOps adds/removes values to/from the destination organization as necessary.
Enter the temporary value to use with Delay on Insert and Deploy Last.
Select to set value to true. Deselect to set value to false.

When selected, UI controls appear in relevant places that allow you to specify remapping source org data to different objects, record types, fields, picklist values, and relationships in the destination org. Refer to the user guide for details.
Specifies the upsert method to use during deployment.
Instructs AppOps when to deploy the actual field value. Select either blank to deploy immediately or the data set element to deploy after.
Record Matching Method
This action deletes all data set elements and relationships in this data set and cannot be undone. Are you sure?
Are you sure? This action permanently deletes all transformations data for this data set and cannot be undone.
You have reached the maximum number of event controls for this data set.
